title: Rewterz Threat Update Unpatched F5 BIG-IP Devices Under Active Attack

meta.title: Rewterz Threat Update Unpatched F5 BIG-IP Devices Under Active Attack

chapters.title: Rewterz Threat Update Unpatched F5 BIG-IP Devices Under Active Attack

sentences.text: CVE-2022-1388 is a critical iControl REST authentication bypass vulnerability affecting different versions of F5 BIG-IP.<crlf>F5 BIG-IP could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by improper input validation. By sending specially-crafted requests to the management port and/or self IP addresses, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary commands, create or delete files, or disable services on the system.
sentences.html: CVE-2022-1388 is a critical iControl REST authentication bypass vulnerability affecting different versions of F5 BIG-IP. F5 BIG-IP could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by improper input validation. By sending specially-crafted requests to the management port and/or self IP addresses, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary commands, create or delete files, or disable services on the system.

sentences.text: Snort signature for especially those organizations who did not immediately patch:<crlf>alert tcp any any -> any $HTTP_PORTS (msg:BIG-IP F5 iControl:HTTP POST URI /mgmt./tm/util/bash and content data command and utilCmdArgs:CVE2022-1388; sid:1; rev:1; flow:established,to_server; flowbits:isnotset,bigip20221388.tagged; content:POST; http_method; content:/mgmt/tm/util/bash; http_uri; content:command; http_client_body; content:utilCmdArgs; http_client_body; flowbits:set,bigip20221388.tagged; tag:session,10,packets; reference:cve2022-1388; reference:url,github.com/alt3kx/CVE-2022-1388_PoC; priority:2; metadata:service http;)
sentences.html: • Snort signature for especially those organizations who did not immediately patch: alert tcp any any -> any $HTTP_PORTS (msg:”BIG-IP F5 iControl:HTTP POST URI ‘/mgmt./tm/util/bash’ and content data ‘command’ and ‘utilCmdArgs’:CVE2022-1388”; sid:1; rev:1; flow:established,to_server; flowbits:isnotset,bigip20221388.tagged; content:”POST”; http_method; content:”/mgmt/tm/util/bash”; http_uri; content:”command”; http_client_body; content:”utilCmdArgs”; http_client_body; flowbits:set,bigip20221388.tagged; tag:session,10,packets; reference:cve2022-1388; reference:url,github.com/alt3kx/CVE-2022-1388_PoC; priority:2; metadata:service http;)

sentences.text: Some of the verified signatures that are successful in detection of both inbound exploitation attempts (SID: 2036546) and post exploitation, indicating code execution (SID: 2036547).
sentences.html: Some of the verified signatures that are successful in detection of both inbound exploitation attempts (SID: 2036546) and post exploitation, indicating code execution (SID: 2036547).

sentences.text: 16.1.x versions prior to 16.1.2.2<crlf>15.1.x versions prior to 15.1.5.1<crlf>14.1.x versions prior to 14.1.4.6<crlf>13.1.x versions prior to 13.1.5<crlf>All 12.1.x and 11.6.x versions
sentences.html:
• 16.1.x versions prior to 16.1.2.2
  • 15.1.x versions prior to 15.1.5.1
  • 14.1.x versions prior to 14.1.4.6
  • 13.1.x versions prior to 13.1.5
  • All 12.1.x and 11.6.x versions

sentences.text: Quarantine potentially affected hosts<crlf>Reimage the infected hosts<crlf>Collect and review data, artifacts, and relevant logs.<crlf>Upgrade F5 BIG-IP software to fixed versions (organizations using versions 12.1.x and 11.6.x should upgrade to supported versions).<crlf>If unable to immediately patch, implement F5s temporary workarounds<crlf>Check more information on the implementation of the workarounds here.<crlf>Maintain and test an incident response plan.<crlf>Prioritizes patch management and vulnerability scanning.<crlf>Configure internet-facing network devices<crlf>Check more considerations and guidance in case of suspecting a security compromise here
sentences.html:
• Quarantine potentially affected hosts
  • Reimage the infected hosts
  • Collect and review data, artifacts, and relevant logs.
  • Upgrade F5 BIG-IP software to fixed versions (organizations using versions 12.1.x and 11.6.x should upgrade to supported versions).
  • If unable to immediately patch, implement F5’s temporary workarounds
  • Check more information on the implementation of the workarounds here.
  • Maintain and test an incident response plan.
  • Prioritizes patch management and vulnerability scanning.
  • Configure internet-facing network devices
  • Check more considerations and guidance in case of suspecting a security compromise here
